history.proof: intros x. unfold Weak. qsimpl time: 1.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Type
X: Type
Red: reduction_t X

Goal:
forall x : X, Weak T x x

Premises:
reduction_t = reduction Lbl : Type -> Type Arguments reduction_t _%type_scope
Weak = fun l : Lbl => match l with | T => star (Red T) | L a => comp (star (Red T)) (comp (Red (L a)) (star (Red T))) end : reduction_t X
Inductive Lbl : Type := T : Lbl | L : A -> Lbl
Inductive star (X : Type) (R : relation X) : relation X := star_refl : forall x : X, star R x x | S_star : forall y x z : X, R x y -> star R y z -> star R x z Arguments star [X]%type_scope Arguments star_refl [X]%type_scope Arguments S_star [X]%type_scope [R y] _ [z]
Inductive sig2 (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop) : Type := exist2 : forall x : A, P x -> Q x -> {x : A | P x & Q x} Arguments sig2 [A]%type_scope (_ _)%type_scope Arguments exist2 [A]%type_scope (_ _)%function_scope
String.eqb_refl : forall x : String.string, String.eqb x x = true

ssrbool.pred = fun T : Type => T -> bool : Type -> Type Arguments ssrbool.pred _%type_scope
Setoid.Seq_refl : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : Relation_Definitions.relation A), Setoid.Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x : A, Aeq x x

Record manifest_mem_pred (T : Type) (p : ssrbool.pred T) : Type := ManifestMemPred { mem_pred_value : ssrbool.mem_pred T; _ : mem_pred_value = ssrbool.Mem (T:=T) (fun x : T => p x) } Arguments ssrbool.manifest_mem_pred [T]%type_scope Arguments ssrbool.ManifestMemPred [T]%type_scope [p mem_pred_value]
ssrbool.ManifestMemPred : forall (T : Type) (p : ssrbool.pred T) (mem_pred_value : ssrbool.mem_pred T), mem_pred_value = ssrbool.Mem (T:=T) (fun x : T => p x) -> ssrbool.manifest_mem_pred (T:=T) p

EWeak = fun l : Lbl => match l with | T => union2 eq (Red T) | L a => Red (L a) end : reduction_t X
Inductive Lbl : Type := T : Lbl | L : A -> Lbl
ssrbool.Mem : forall T : Type, ssrbool.pred T -> ssrbool.mem_pred T
REWeak = fun l : Lbl => match l with | T => union2 eq (Red T) | L a => comp (Red (L a)) (star (Red T)) end : reduction_t X

Ring_theory.ARmul_1_l : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x

BinIntDef.Z.succ = fun x : BinNums.Z => BinIntDef.Z.add x (BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH) : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.succ _%Z_scope
Ring_theory.ARopp_add : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y : R, req (ropp (radd x y)) (radd (ropp x) (ropp y))

BinNat.N.le = fun x y : BinNums.N => BinNat.N.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.le (_ _)%N_scope
